Authors: Surjandy, Meyliana, Fernando E., Wiryawan D., Wijaya S.
Title: Impact of the Entrepreneur Course and Technology for University Students
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Surjandy, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meyliana, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fernando, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wiryawan, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Indonesia so far still needs many entrepreneurs, as the president of Indonesia said, written at national media in April 2018. Bina Nusantara University has implemented Entrepreneur lesson for all university students, so the case study of this research objective to see the impact of the courses and technology that have been taught to university students who do business after receiving the lesson. This study uses time series to gather the multi year's data for about 158 university students who do business after the students receive entrepreneur lessons. The method of quantitative descriptive analysis, with bivariate correlation to see the correlation variables and this study found 17 significant relationships that are very useful for the development of the creation of entrepreneurs in the future. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Curricula; Information management; Bivariate correlations; entrepreneur; Indonesia; Quantitative descriptive analysis; Quantitative method; Research objectives; University students; Students

Title: Implementation of the acunetix for testing the banking website (owned by the government and non-government in Indonesia)
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wiryawan, D., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Noerlina, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Nowadays, information technology security system is a matter that cannot be denied. The exchange of information which is done by online (via the web) requires a high trust. Moreover, each party must maintain a security system for the transaction. However, not all websites owned by company have a good security system. People really need information about the security system, so as to avoid the things that are not desirable in the future. This study is expected to be useful information for the various interested parties or need the information regarding what security technology is, how to evaluate it, and what steps need to be taken to overcome the security technology. © 2016 International Information Institute.
